Members of the Ministerial Committee for the Corona Virus (Corona Cabinet) approved the outline of activities in malls and commercial complexes    Members of the Ministerial Committee for the Corona Virus (Corona Cabinet) have now approved (in a telephone poll) the outline of activities in malls and commercial complexes, as presented by the National Security Headquarters (National Security Council), in coordination with the Ministry of Health, in the latest cabinet discussion.    The decision stipulates that:    â¢ Malls will operate in a purple character format , according to an occupancy ratio of 1:15 (one person every 15 meters).    â¢ Entrance to stores with an area of ??more than 100 square meters will be possible subject to the presentation of a green sign , both in open areas and in malls and closed shopping complexes. The obligation of the green mark will also apply to the employees in these stores.    â¢ The food stalls in the malls will provide service to customers subject to the presentation of a green label , and will not allow seating but only self-collection.    â¢ Entrance to restaurants located inside a mall will be allowed subject to the presentation of a green label , in accordance with the format currently used in restaurants.    - The green mark in malls and shopping complexes will not apply to places that provide essential services , as detailed below: a store for the sale of hygiene products (Pharm), an optician, a store for the sale of medical aids, a supermarket, a grocery store or a supermarket. In these places, the current format will continue (purple character in an occupancy ratio of 1: 7).    The regulations will enter into force on Sunday, December 26, 2021, 22 Tevet, at midnight (the night between Sunday and Monday), subject to the approval of the Knesset's Constitution Committee.    Source: https://archive.vn/Xamg3 [Prime Minister's Office press release]

From December,01, authorities in Tunisia require all arriving international travellers over the age of 18 to present a COVID-19 vaccination certificate or vaccine passport to enter the country. Additionally, all travellers over six years of age must present a negative result from a PCR test taken no more than 48 hours before departure for Tunisia. The test result must include a quick response (QR) code. Arriving individuals who have not been fully vaccinated against COVID-19 must undergo a mandatory 10-days quarantine period at a government-approved hotel at their own expenses. During the last 24 hours of their mandatory quarantine period, they will be tested for COVID-19 using PCR test. Those testing negative may exit isolation, authorities will transfer those testing positive to a health isolation facility. Travellers must also complete health declaration questionnaire before departure for Tunisia and may be subject to a rapid antigen test upon arrival and be placed into quarantine if the result is positive. Source: Garda World  Archived link: https://web.archive.org/web/20220101235258/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/550351/tunisia-authorities-to-require-arriving-international-travelers-to-present-covid-19-vaccine-passport-or-certificate-from-dec-1-update-71
